instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Component Sizing -> text
input: What does \\(\\rho_air\\) represent in the single zone VAV model equation?
output: \\(\\rho_air\\) is the density of air at standard conditions (kg/m\\(^3\\)).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Component Sizing -> text
input: What does c\\(_pair\\) represent in the single zone VAV model equation?
output: c\\(_pair\\) is the specific heat of zone air (J/kg K).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Component Sizing -> text
input: What does V\\(_airmin\\) represent in the single zone VAV model equation?
output: V\\(_airmin\\) is the air volume flow rate at minimum fan speed (m\\(^3\\)/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What happens after the Sizing Manager completes its initial pass?
output: After the Sizing Manager has completed its initial pass all the data needed to complete a running model should be available and the program is ready to run the main simulation(s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What new option was introduced in Version 8.3?
output: As of Version 8.3 there is now an option of applying some advanced sizing calculations using what are called HVAC Sizing Simulations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: How does the new sizing method introduced in Version 8.3 differ?
output: With this new sizing method we distinguish between different kinds of simulations and introduce some new terminology.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What are the Primary Simulations?
output: The Primary Simulations are the main simulations that are the final version of the model to be run.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What were the Primary Simulations prior to Version 8.3?
output: Prior to Version 8.3 these are just the usual simulations with the final results.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What is meant by Ideal Loads Sizing Simulations?
output: When the program is running the zone heat balance model over the sizing periods for zone sizing (for step 3 in the Sizing Manager description above) we call those Ideal Loads Sizing Simulations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What are Ideal Component Loads Simulations?
output: When the program is running the zone heat balance model over the sizing periods for component loads calculations we call those Ideal Component Loads Simulations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What is an HVAC Sizing Simulation?
output: HVAC Sizing Simulations are a kind of simulation where the program creates copies of sizing periods and runs them as complete EnergyPlus simulations with the most current equipment sizes and full HVAC systems.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What do the advanced sizing algorithms do during the HVAC Sizing Simulations?
output: The advanced sizing algorithms monitor what occurred during those sizing periods and determine if new size results are needed signaling systems and components to repeat their sizing calculations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What is a Sizing Pass?
output: A Sizing Pass refers to a set of the HVAC Sizing Simulations for each of the sizing periods (e.g. two design days).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What happens if the user selects a sizing option requiring HVAC Sizing Simulations?
output: If the user has selected a sizing option that requires HVAC Sizing Simulations the main ManageSimulation will call ManageHVACSizingSimulation before going on to the main simulations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What is the first step in the HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager process?
output: Instantiate a new HVACSizingSimulationManager object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What does the DetermineSizingAnalysesNeeded() method do?
output: Call DetermineSizingAnalysesNeeded(). This checks what user input and decides what if anything needs to be done for advanced sizing algorithms.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What does the SetupSizingAnalyses() method create?
output: This method creates the data logging apparatus needed to monitor operation during HVAC Sizing Simulations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What do individual sizing algorithms include?
output: Individual sizing algorithms include selecting specific variables such as system node states or load output variables that will be recorded.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What does the Loop over some number of Sizing Passes involve?
output: The set of sizing periods run as HVAC Sizing Simulations can iterate up to a maximum limit on the number of passes.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What happens during the Loop over all the sizing periods by each day?
output: This runs the HVAC Sizing Simulations which have basically the same set of calls as are used for marching through time and calling of EnergyPlus modeling for the Primary Simulations (in ManageSimulation).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What does the PostProcessLogs() method do?
output: This method applies running averages (if desired) and averages system timestep data to fill zone timestep data in the records.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What is the function of the ProcessCoincidentPlantSizeAdjustments() method?
output: This method retrieves data from the logs and calls for the coincident plant sizing algorithm to execute.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What does the RedoKickOffAndResize() method do?
output: The method calls SetupSimulation() and sets flag to signal that system and component level sizing methods need to be called again.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: When does the Sizing Pass loop break?
output: The loop breaks if size results did not change or the limit on Sizing Passes has been reached.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What is done to free memory in the HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager?
output: Empty HVACSizingSimulationManager object to free memory.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: What is the current application for HVAC Sizing Simulations?
output: Currently the only application for HVAC Sizing Simulations is to improve the sizing of plant loops using the Coincident sizing option.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: HVAC Sizing Simulation Manager -> text
input: Could the approach for HVAC Sizing Simulations be expanded in the future?
output: This approach may be expanded in the future to extend advanced sizing methods to air-side equipment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Plant and Condenser Loop Sizing -> text
input: What does the program need to be able to do in terms of plant fluid loops?
output: The program needs to be able to autosize the fluid flow rate in each plant fluid loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Plant and Condenser Loop Sizing -> text
input: How are the design plant loop flow rates determined?
output: The design plant loop flow rates are set by the sum of the needs of the demanding components on each loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Plant and Condenser Loop Sizing -> text
input: What components are involved in chilled water loops?
output: For chilled water loops the components involved are cooling coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Plant and Condenser Loop Sizing -> text
input: What components are involved in hot water loops?
output: For hot water loops the components involved are hot water coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Plant and Condenser Loop Sizing -> text
input: What components are involved in condenser loops?
output: For condenser loops the components involved are various types of chiller that use condenser water for cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Plant and Condenser Loop Sizing -> text
input: Where is the design water flow rate for each component stored?
output: Each component that uses water for heating or cooling stores its design water flow rate in the array CompDesWaterFlow labeled by its inlet water supply node number.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Plant and Condenser Loop Sizing -> text
input: How are the individual component design water flow rates used?
output: These individual component design water flow rates are accessed summed for each plant loop and stored in the PlantSizingData array.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Plant and Condenser Loop Sizing -> text
input: What additional information does the PlantSizingData array contain?
output: The PlantSizingData array also contains the user specified design values for each plant loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Maximum Loop Flow Rate -> text
input: How is the loop maximum volume flow rate determined?
output: The loop maximum volume flow rate is set equal to the value stored in the PlantSizingData array for this loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Loop Volume -> text
input: How is the loop volume calculated?
output: The loop volume is calculated as the product of the maximum loop volume flow rate and the user input for loop circulation time which defaults to 2 minutes.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Loop Volume -> equation
input: What is the equation for calculating the loop volume?
output: V_loop = \\dotV_loopmax \\cdot t_loop \\cdot 60

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Loop Volume -> text
input: What do the variables in the loop volume equation represent?
output: In the equation \\(\\dotV_loopmax\\) represents the maximum loop volume flow rate (m\\(^3\\)/s) and \\(t_loop\\) represents the loop circulation time (minutes).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What manages the sizing calculations in EnergyPlus?
output: The sizing calculations in EnergyPlus are managed by a sizing manager contained in the software module SizingManager.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: When is the main sizing manager routine ManageSizing called?
output: The main sizing manager routine ManageSizing is called from ManageSimulation before the annual simulation sequence is invoked.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What tasks does ManageSizing perform?
output: ManageSizing performs tasks such as reading user sizing input setting flags looping over sizing periods and calling various functions for design calculations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: Which function reads in all the user sizing input contained in objects Sizing:Parameters Sizing:Zone Sizing:System and Sizing:Plant?
output: The function GetSizingParams GetZoneSizingInput GetSystemSizingInput and GetPlantSizingInput read in all the user sizing input contained in objects Sizing:Parameters Sizing:Zone Sizing:System and Sizing:Plant.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What does setting the ZoneSizingCalc flag to true indicate?
output: Setting the ZoneSizingCalc flag to true indicates that zone design calculations are to be performed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What starts the zone design calculations?
output: Looping over all the sizing periods by each day starts the zone design calculations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What is the purpose of calling UpdateZoneSizing(BeginDay)?
output: Calling UpdateZoneSizing(BeginDay) initializes zone design load and flow rate sequences.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What does the HVACManager do during zone design calculations?
output: During zone design calculations the HVACManager ignores the real HVAC system and instead runs the ideal zonal system to calculate design loads and flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What does calling UpdateZoneSizing(EndDay) accomplish?
output: Calling UpdateZoneSizing(EndDay) calculates peaks and moving averages from the zone design sequences for each design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What does calling UpdateZoneSizing(EndZoneSizingCalc) do?
output: Calling UpdateZoneSizing(EndZoneSizingCalc) calculates for each zone the peak heating & cooling loads and flow rates over all the sizing periods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What does setting the SysSizingCalc flag to true indicate?
output: Setting the SysSizingCalc flag to true indicates that system design calculations are to be performed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What is the purpose of calling ManageZoneEquipment and ManageAirLoops?
output: Calling ManageZoneEquipment and ManageAirLoops reads in the zone and central system inputs needed for the system design calculations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What starts the system design calculations?
output: Looping over all the sizing periods by each day starts the system design calculations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What is the purpose of calling UpdateSysSizing(BeginDay)?
output: Calling UpdateSysSizing(BeginDay) initializes system design load and flow rate sequences.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What does calling UpdateSysSizing(DuringDay) accomplish?
output: Calling UpdateSysSizing(DuringDay) saves the results of the system design calculations in the system design load and flow rate sequences.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What does calling UpdateSysSizing(EndDay) accomplish?
output: Calling UpdateSysSizing(EndDay) calculates peaks and moving averages from the system design sequences for each sizing period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What does calling UpdateSysSizing(EndSysSizingCalc) do?
output: Calling UpdateSysSizing(EndSysSizingCalc) calculates for each system the peak heating & cooling loads and flow rates over all the sizing periods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What marks the end of the system design calculations?
output: Calling UpdateSysSizing(EndSysSizingCalc) marks the end of the system design calculations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: Sizing Manager -> text
input: What marks the end of the tasks of the Sizing Manager?
output: The tasks of the Sizing Manager end after the system design calculations are completed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the system design calculation?
output: The purpose of the system design calculation is to estimate design heating and cooling loads and air flow rates for each air loop in the simulation problem.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: How does the calculation sequence for system level design loads and air flow rates compare to zone loads and air flow rates?
output: The calculation sequence for system level design loads and air flow rates resembles the calculation sequence for zone loads and air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: What is the role of the UpdateSysSizing subroutine?
output: The update subroutine UpdateSysSizing is called at the beginning during and end of a loop in the Sizing Manager over all the design days.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: What is the major difference between system design calculation and zone calculation?
output: The major difference is that the system design calculation is done at the zone time-step only and there is no idealized component calculation triggered at the system time-step as in the zone calculation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: At what time step does the system design calculation operate?
output: The system design calculation operates at the zone time step using the design environment weather data and the data stored in the zone sizing arrays.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: Where are the results of the system design calculation stored?
output: The results of the system design calculation are stored in the system sizing arrays described below.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: What are the system design data arrays?
output: The system design data arrays are: SysSizInput(i) SysSizing(ij) CalcSysSizing(i) and FinalSysSizing(i).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: What does SysSizInput(i) store?
output: SysSizInput(i) stores the input data from the Sizing:System objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: What does SysSizing(ij) store?
output: SysSizing(ij) stores the results of the system design calculations for all systems and all design days. The index i is for air loops j for design days.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: What does CalcSysSizing(i) store?
output: CalcSysSizing(i) stores the results of the system design calculations for the peak heating and cooling cases for each air loop. The index i is for the air loops.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: What does FinalSysSizing(i) correspond to and what does it include?
output: FinalSysSizing(i) corresponds to CalcSysSizing but includes the effect of the user specified sizing factor or user specified system design flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table: System Sizing Data
input: What is included in the data stored in SysSizing CalcSysSizing and FinalSysSizing?
output: The data stored in SysSizing CalcSysSizing and FinalSysSizing includes various system sizing data items.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table: System Sizing Data
input: What does the table caption 'System Sizing Data' refer to?
output: The table caption 'System Sizing Data' refers to a table that lists the names and descriptions of system sizing data items.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What does 'All the data from SysSizInput' refer to in the table?
output: In the table 'All the data from SysSizInput' refers to the input data from the Sizing:System objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'CoinCoolMassFlow' in the table?
output: 'CoinCoolMassFlow' in the table is the coincident peak cooling mass flow rate [kg/s].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'CoinHeatMassFlow' in the table?
output: 'CoinHeatMassFlow' in the table is the coincident peak heating mass flow rate [kg/s].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'NonCoinCoolMassFlow' in the table?
output: 'NonCoinCoolMassFlow' in the table is the noncoincident peak cooling mass flow rate [kg/s].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'NonCoinHeatMassFlow' in the table?
output: 'NonCoinHeatMassFlow' in the table is the noncoincident peak heating mass flow rate [kg/s].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'DesMainVolFlow' in the table?
output: 'DesMainVolFlow' in the table is the design main supply duct volume flow [m³/s].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'DesHeatVolFlow' in the table?
output: 'DesHeatVolFlow' in the table is the design heat supply duct volume flow [m³/s].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'DesCoolVolFlow' in the table?
output: 'DesCoolVolFlow' in the table is the design cool supply duct volume flow [m³/s].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'SensCoolCap' in the table?
output: 'SensCoolCap' in the table is the design sensible cooling capacity [W].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'TotCoolCap' in the table?
output: 'TotCoolCap' in the table is the design total cooling capacity [W].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'HeatCap' in the table?
output: 'HeatCap' in the table is the design heating capacity [W].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'PreheatCap' in the table?
output: 'PreheatCap' in the table is the design preheat capacity [W].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'MixTempAtCoolPeak' in the table?
output: 'MixTempAtCoolPeak' in the table is the mixed air temperature at the time of the cooling peak [C].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'MixHumRatAtCoolPeak' in the table?
output: 'MixHumRatAtCoolPeak' in the table is the mixed air humidity ratio at the time of the cooling peak [kg water/kg dry air].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'RetTempAtCoolPeak' in the table?
output: 'RetTempAtCoolPeak' in the table is the return air temperature at the time of the cooling peak [C].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'RetHumRatAtCoolPeak' in the table?
output: 'RetHumRatAtCoolPeak' in the table is the return air humidity ratio at the time of the cooling peak [kg water/kg dry air].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'OutTempAtCoolPeak' in the table?
output: 'OutTempAtCoolPeak' in the table is the outside air temperature at the time of the cooling peak [C].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data
input: What is 'OutHumRatAtCoolPeak' in the table?
output: 'OutHumRatAtCoolPeak' in the table is the outside air humidity ratio at the time of the cooling peak [kg water/kg dry air].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> table row: System Sizing Data

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Flow Rate and Load Summation and Adjustment -> text
input: Is there a system level subroutine corresponding to 'SizeZoneEquipment'?
output: There is no system level subroutine corresponding to 'SizeZoneEquipment'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Flow Rate and Load Summation and Adjustment -> text
input: How are system design loads and flow rates calculated?
output: The system design loads and flow rates are calculated using the zone level results.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Flow Rate and Load Summation and Adjustment -> text
input: What happens if latent loads are greater than sensible loads during latent sizing?
output: If latent sizing is requested and latent loads are greater than sensible loads the latent design load and air mass flow rate are used for that zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Flow Rate and Load Summation and Adjustment -> text
input: How are system level design flow rates obtained?
output: The zone design flow rates for the zones served by an air loop are summed to obtain the system level design flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Flow Rate and Load Summation and Adjustment -> text
input: How are system design coil loads obtained?
output: The air flows are mixed with the system level design minimum outside air flow rate to obtain system design coil loads.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Flow Rate and Load Summation and Adjustment -> text
input: Which subroutine performs the activities related to system design flow rate and load summation?
output: These activities are all performed within the 'UpdateSysSizing' subroutine in the 'SimAirServingZones' module.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Flow Rate and Load Summation and Adjustment -> text
input: When is the 'UpdateSysSizing' subroutine called?
output: It is called at the start of each design day ('CallIndicator = BeginDay') at the zone time-step ('CallIndicator = DuringDay') at the end of the design day ('CallIndicator = EndDay') and at the end of the zone design calculation ('CallIndicator = EndSysSizingCalc').

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Flow Rate and Load Summation and Adjustment -> text
input: What is the purpose of the logical flag 'SysSizingCalc'?
output: The logical flag 'SysSizingCalc' is used to allow the component routines to distinguish a normal simulation call from being called during a system sizing calculation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Flow Rate and Load Summation and Adjustment -> text
input: What does a reference to a 'zone' mean in this section?
output: In this section any reference to a 'zone' is equivalent to 'air terminal unit'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: BeginDay -> text
input: What is stored in the system sizing data structures during 'BeginDay'?
output: The environment (in this case a design day) name is stored in the system sizing data structures.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: BeginDay -> text
input: What is the first step in the 'BeginDay' process?
output: The first step is to loop over the zones cooled by this air loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: BeginDay -> equation
input: What is the equation for 'NonCoinCoolMassFlow_sys'?
output: NonCoinCoolMassFlow_sys = Σ DesCoolMassFlow_zone

input: What is the next step after looping over cooled zones in 'BeginDay'?
output: The next step is to loop over the zones heated by this air loop.

input: What is the equation for 'NonCoinHeatMassFlow_sys'?
output: NonCoinHeatMassFlow_sys = Σ DesHeatMassFlow_zone

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> equation
input: What is the equation for CoolFlowSeq_sys(i)?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> equation
input: What is the equation for SysCoolRetTemp(i)?
output: SysCoolRetTemp(i) = Σ (CoolZoneRetTempSeq(i) * CoolFlowSeq_zone(i))/ CoolFlowSeq_sys(i)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> equation
input: What is the equation for SysCoolRetHumRat(i)?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> equation
input: What is the equation for FracOA?
output: FracOA = ρ_air * DesOutAirVolFlow_sys/ CoolFlowSeq_sys(i)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> equation
input: What is the equation for T_mix?
output: T_mix = T_outside * FracOA + SysCoolRetTemp(i)(1 - FracOA)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> equation
input: What is the equation for W_mix?
output: W_mix = W_outside * FracOA + SysCoolRetHumRat(i)(1 - FracOA)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> equation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Design Loads and Air Flow Rates -> text
input: Why is noncoincident sizing more challenging?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Sizing Adjustments for Air Terminal Operation -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Sizing Adjustments for Air Terminal Operation -> text
input: When were the system sizing adjustments added?
output: These system sizing adjustments were added as of version 8.9 of EnergyPlus.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Sizing Adjustments for Air Terminal Operation -> text
input: What is the basic idea behind the system sizing adjustments?
output: The basic idea is to account for operating details of the air terminal units attached to the system by making adjustments to the system sizing results after the zone equipment has been setup and sized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Loop Equipment Sizing and other Design Data -> Section: System Sizing Adjustments for Air Terminal Operation -> text
input: What does the routine ManageSystemSizingAdjustments do?
output: The routine ManageSystemSizingAdjustments has been added that first sets up the zone equipment and then makes adjustments to the system sizing by mining information from the air terminal models for minimum flow fractions operating modes during heating and any user-defined hard sizes to improve accuracy.

input: What does the program store regarding airloop dominance?

input: What are the additional adjustments made to system air flow sizes based on?
